text: Feel free to show whatever you have at anytime. Sync sketch is a very useful site to upload animation and do feedback as it allows me to do drawovers. If you make a free account on there and then send me a link to the file I'll be able to give you feedback.
The DreamWorks talk sounds great, I think it's always useful to experiment with different animation styles - as long as the character posing and acting is still readable and entertaining
I think notifications on this are just going to be terrible! Hence my later reply :sweat_smile:

As for me I'm a recruiter at Blue Zoo, so I recruit staff and spend all day looking at billions of showreels and portfolios, but I'm also a trained animator from a Master's degree in Animation I did at Bournemouth university
I don't have a website for this though, however I recently directed an animated music video at my studio this Christmas for one of Sony Music Labels British bands which I can send you a link to

attachments.title: Let's Not Go Away
attachments.text:
Watch the Making of: 

Every Christmas we do something a bit unique that represents and challenges our studio's diverse styles and skills. This time we have turned to our new dedicated 2D animation studio who have created something very special.

The first 2D #BZshorts film is directed by People and Talent Coordinator, Katie Gascoyne. Our commitment to pioneering new talent and giving opportunities to ALL staff is at the heart of the shorts program. This year, there was a blind pitch where the whole company was invited to pitch an idea for the music video to Scouting for Girl’s Christmas single. Specifically, the brief asked for an “odd couple.” Katie won the blind pitch with a heart-warming pairing between Dan, a living gingerbread man, and his human girlfriend, Mandy.

text: It is in 2D though as I worked with the 2D studio on it, but it still shows a lot of thoughtful character animation techniques.
My CV and work history is a bit of weird one you could say! Haha
